intro: Herniaria glabra proles ceretanica, commonly known as the smooth herniaria, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of tiny, white flowers. The plant typically thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and rocky habitats. It has a compact growth habit and is well adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its flowers bloom in early summer and are visited by various pollinators such as bees and flies.
